Detailed Description

a synchronisation primitive

Mutex Semaphore. the next thread to be activated is selected according to priorities and not come first serve first.

Definition at line 70 of file semaphore.h.

Constructor

Member Function Documentation

void RODOS::Semaphore::enter ( )

caller will be blocked if semaphore is occupied The owner may reenter the semaphore without deadlock

Referenced by enterRetTrue().

bool RODOS::Semaphore::enterRetTrue ( ) [inline]

This ist jus a help für the macro PROTECT_WITH_SEMAPHORE.

true if semaphore is free: Warning: next it can be occupied by someone else

void RODOS::Semaphore::leave ( )

caller does not block. resumes one waiting thread (enter)
